concept.title: FAQ for AEM
concept.shortdesc: Find answers to frequently asked questions about the AEM migration.

section.title: Why is IBM moving to the Adobe platform?
section.p: Adobe is a strategic partner of IBM. IBM leadership has stated that a goal is to move IBM process and applications to our strategic partner platforms. For more information, see the CIO blog.

section.title: What is the time line for this migrations?
section.p: There is no time line for this migration at this time. We will let you know when a time line is determined.

section.title: Will this migration impact my release or GA?
section.p: This migration will not impact your release or GA. Our plan is to automate much of the migration and we also have help from Adobe experts for the migration.

section.title: What documentation applications are impacted for this migration?
section.p:
The following applications are impacted and will eventually be sunset. When the following applications will be sunset is TBD.
IBM Workflow Manager (WFM)
IBM Review Manager (RM)
IBM Docs Manager (IDM)
IBM Docs COS Viewer
IBM Docs
Product documentation
Announcement Letters
Sales Manuals
Redbooks

section.title: Where will my source files be hosted?
section.p: Your source files will move from IBM GitHub repositories to Adobe Assets, which is part of the Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) platform. IBM GitHub as a platform is not going away. Documentation source files will no longer be stored in GitHub repositories.

section.title: Where can I go to get started on education?
section.p: At this point in time, you do not need to worry about education. We will provide detailed education for all content creators at a later point in time.

section.title: Will the URL's change from today?
Will Markdown and AsciiDoc be supported on the AEM platform?
section.p: To be determined. DITA source files are supported on the AEM platform.
